page.title: 18Safety at Sea
page.content: When we studied our area we looked out over the estuary to see all the small craft at{Instow}and the larger boats sailing in and out of Bideford. In June two elderly men were fishing from a small boat, it overturned and one man was drowned. The lifeboat from Appledore picked up both men and the helicopter from Chivenor lifted both men and took them to the North Devon District Hospital. Unfortunately one man was beyond recovery. It made us realise that the estuary can be very dangerous place to swim or sail. There are a few lifebelts and ropes on the shoreline but it would be impossible to rescue someone from the shore if the tide was sweeping them away. The current on an outgoing tide is often too strong for small boats never mind swimmers.
